elements.2211.03057_d07f0fd6f9efa8bd1029e47f0a4dc: As the Metaverse is iteratively being defined, its potential to unleash the next wave of digital disruption and create real-life value becomes increasingly clear
elements.2211.03057_e00c62d0ce968fa2317660bd9a2c3: With distinctive features of immersive experience, simultaneous interactivity, and user agency, the Metaverse has the capability to transform all walks of life
elements.2211.03057_ff8aa384480f65703f0bf99648ba7: However, the enabling technologies of the Metaverse, i.e., digital twin, artificial intelligence, blockchain, and extended reality, are known to be energy-hungry, therefore raising concerns about the sustainability of its large-scale deployment and development
elements.2211.03057_6bb42c5cdc3231f2c6b6e6604095d: This article proposes Green Metaverse Networking for the first time to optimize energy efficiencies of all network components for Metaverse sustainable development
elements.2211.03057_84b161333ddb0d4735c7cda348e7b: We first analyze energy consumption, efficiency, and sustainability of energy-intensive technologies in the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_881e19e4d1d430ae689f733af09bc: Next, focusing on computation and networking, we present major advancements related to energy efficiency and their integration into the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_5f849a37822bf9de1e51bd51c135a: A case study of energy conservation by incorporating semantic communication and stochastic resource allocation in the Metaverse is presented
elements.2211.03057_d9864324ecda85b33faad7df20f4f: Finally, we outline the critical challenges of Metaverse sustainable development, thereby indicating potential directions of future research towards the green Metaverse.
elements.2211.03057_78ba25bcbb9da5ab4fa363b8545d0: Metaverse, Energy Efficiency, Sustainability, Digital Twin, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Extended Reality
elements.2211.03057_9db70ee04aa26a2fa9a2c0d0d3537: The Metaverse is arriving at an inflection point of development thirty years after the term was first coined in Neal Stephenson's science-fiction novel "Snow Crash"
elements.2211.03057_2fd7ab86c7ed75856ef5310d019cf: While its definition is still fluid today, the Metaverse is generally regarded as an embodied version of the Internet that seamlessly synergizes virtual and physical worlds, and enables users to live and interact in virtual worlds through controlling personalized avatars.
elements.2211.03057_74e787d3607893112eee500c61c48: A growing amount of commitment, investment, and effort has been made to realize the Metaverse across academia and industry
elements.2211.03057_d52dc4a7139edfa540568928953f2: For the former, the number of research publications related to the Metaverse in 2022 is five times more than that in 2021
elements.2211.03057_691b5da3eb726008f6d0b4d2bca35: For the latter, Facebook was rebranded as Meta to shift from a media company to a Metaverse company in 2021
elements.2211.03057_13fa5045c6a2901f090e2df58bdbc: Such excitement about the Metaverse is driven by improved technical and marketplace readiness
elements.2211.03057_a59ba5377a89dd18661acf61eaae7: For example, the enabling technologies of the Metaverse have undergone rapid advancements recently, including the Internet-of-Things (IoT), digital twin (DT), 5G/6G, artificial intelligence (AI), blockchain, virtual reality (VR), and augmented reality (AR)
elements.2211.03057_e038c6949c89f4c54fa88d489b7a1: Moreover, the COVID-19 pandemic has accustomed users to embracing digital life, e.g., online meetings and shopping.
elements.2211.03057_d023497742ba1d7da21fb86b1e14f: As compared to the massively multiplayer online role-playing games (MMORPGs) of today, the Metaverse is a far broader concept that features user-generated contents (UGCs), a variety of use cases, decentralization, and interoperability across platforms and devices
elements.2211.03057_9f94f08cdb7542b378b07c16c1c44: However, there are still technical deficiencies in communication speed, computing power, data storage, etc., to fully realize the envisioned Metaverse, not to mention social barriers
elements.2211.03057_cd57304cee9b1aa0e2db2a6a3a7d1: As the Metaverse is relatively nascent, most research has been centered on Metaverse architecture, enabling technologies, and applications
elements.2211.03057_217d76be159c3d1d824bb5151fff3: discusses the Metaverse implementation at mobile edge networks at scale
elements.2211.03057_7b8334e89a873004f886a6736c012: It presents a visionary four-layer architecture positioning enabling technologies in the edge-enabled Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_19cdfe675b927e2562ccf4a30cbe9: addresses social aspects of the Metaverse, e.g., acceptance, security, and privacy
elements.2211.03057_f59aa3306b950213703e4debff804: While the sustainability aspect has been pointed out in the aforementioned studies, no study has yet to evaluate the energy consumption, efficiency, and sustainability of the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_76ef0fd8b959032e9df3b28217d9d: The energy demand could be easily escalated as the Metaverse will require 1000-fold more computing power and push data usage by 20 times in the next 10 years.
elements.2211.03057_28b19b01d39d7d1bd7ec1cb7258e7: From our perspective, Metaverse sustainability is the ability of the Metaverse to exist and develop without depleting natural resources for the future, e.g., fossil fuels for energy and raw materials for electronic devices
elements.2211.03057_575fca7d677828dc82374c4b9b298: It is becoming particularly critical due to increasing economic and environmental costs, user awareness, and stringent sustainability targets such as the Net Zero coalition.
elements.2211.03057_e1e0ea271d1c8e82f25a3a9db1975: Therefore, this article makes the first effort to advocate attention to optimizing energy efficiencies of all network components for realizing the Metaverse, i.e., Green Metaverse Networking (GMN)
elements.2211.03057_0bc08429b4726df5959c0660d280d: The article provides an analytical framework in a technology-based approach for evaluating energy efficiency
elements.2211.03057_c2c5872071bbbdb49617c35d4e8db: Specifically, our framework centers around the four main groups of energy-hungry enabling technologies namely:
elements.2211.03057_05e4fff195e0fdb3588e4ff546555: about creating and operating the Metaverse,
elements.2211.03057_6c0c9774b6787cb6efa4226faf5b3: about endowing the Metaverse with autonomy and intelligence,
elements.2211.03057_9d1fd081817c832169fd2662de26b: about user interaction with the Metaverse, and
elements.2211.03057_56d94831e68523d451a60f1aad37e: about data storage and interoperability in the Metaverse.
elements.2211.03057_bb686f26f093d0e49fb6a7ed7b774: The structure and contributions of this article are as follows:
elements.2211.03057_ed0c3a1153f0e246160981b46d0c2: We identify energy-hungry technologies and their application scenarios in the Metaverse, analyze their consumption, efficiency, and influencing factors, and outline sustainability-related metrics, thereby providing a guideline for GMN assessment in Section
elements.2211.03057_9cfc96c287992c8bf0fcb3200bcfd: We discuss forefront advancements in computation and networking of these technologies to boost the Metaverse energy efficiency and sustainability in Section
elements.2211.03057_b3b59c393653fb2881ef605a466e6: Through a case study in Section
elements.2211.03057_f5455110ec0de75e98fee7591e244: , we illustrate how semantic communication and stochastic resource allocation can contribute to energy conservation, thereby guiding the design of future communication systems for the Metaverse.
elements.2211.03057_1bf27049015d6519a0b114ce0d5c5: We discuss the key challenges and future research directions towards the GMN in Section
elements.2211.03057_8420c273dba7c0d6ac14b182815de: Energy-Hungry Technologies, Energy Consumption, Efficiency and Metrics
elements.2211.03057_97618596babf93087369b1095e47a: Metaverse is made possible due to the development of enabling technologies
elements.2211.03057_48fbc286070e86ac44515f53214a3: But many of them are energy-hungry
elements.2211.03057_10f145614f77f26fa0da97a7a06a4: Their sustainability-related metrics are summarized in Table
elements.2211.03057_792b5b374ee30c9a0579d04e06130: The DT is a digital representation that accurately reflects the physical world
elements.2211.03057_4d97dd7bb4f0c99b6c934da3d7800: It provides real-time visibility, data analytics, and the capability to predict potential changes in the physical world
elements.2211.03057_307485ef040aa7590a218a66ff985: As the backbone of DT, IoT collects physical data by networked sensors, derives insights from data by edge processors, transmits insights by gateways, and proceeds Metaverse commands by executors (Fig.
elements.2211.03057_24cb818635e37b46a94669ac2910f: IoT devices are becoming unprecedentedly ubiquitous
elements.2211.03057_b4d40f244a52286b2b0cf926972b6: The number of IoT devices is estimated to be 29 billion in 2030
elements.2211.03057_22e89159115b81626f6b248d1d6b1: Although the power consumption of each IoT device is as low as 10 nW to 10 W, such large-scale IoT deployment will make a significant global impact on the environment, especially since most devices are wireless and powered by batteries.
elements.2211.03057_036bf7de0cfc33afab837cacc9e9c: Network efficiency has a considerable influence on DT energy consumption, including radio networks, IoT, wireless sensor networks (WSNs), and other computer networks
elements.2211.03057_532b0b9aa85db3cc9945a52b7b74b: It varies depending on the network device, communication mode, protocol, and software implementation
elements.2211.03057_8ef07232c29d772d03d35b1e72583: Typically, network efficiency is measured by the average power consumption at a certain level of service quality
elements.2211.03057_1c6168bcd183ec9ea739e9b0a4c87: The Quality of Service (QoS) metrics such as throughput, latency, and packet loss are well-defined to evaluate classical information-theoretic network performance
elements.2211.03057_00a3353015d5fda0bfb4ae0ce72ff: However, the perceived quality by users could be of more importance, especially for content providers
elements.2211.03057_6f9517e87eea332017aef4d34f4bb: For example for video streaming, users could be sensitive to quality degradation due to varying bit rates although the throughput is high
elements.2211.03057_e94424f71f992daf640aaaa9b8983: Maintaining the bit rate at a lower but stable level, i.e. lower QoS, could improve user experience and reduce energy consumption at the same time
elements.2211.03057_98f5eaf5758979f59ee8d65666901: Therefore, a paradigm shift towards quality of experience (QoE) is called by content-centric Metaverse applications to focus on the overall acceptability of service perceived by the user
elements.2211.03057_2f4d680571b865ae1f84271912229: For wireless communications, the energy efficiency is addressed by data rate per power (in bit/J), which is currently at the order of 10 Mbit/J. Spectral efficiency (in bps/Hz) measures the data throughput over a given spectrum for a site
elements.2211.03057_f7cd4857824a4f4095c0a079fc1df: /J) is the primary energy efficiency metric for current wireless systems, which equals spectral efficiency divided by area coverage and energy consumption. 5G pledges 10 times higher area energy efficiency than 4G
elements.2211.03057_bd86786b6b1ff653672e679532485: Along with the rapid emergence of aerial nodes such as UAVs, volumetric energy efficiency (in bps/Hz/m
elements.2211.03057_32d153bca47cb8de8de0e166d15ee: /J) is expected to supersede in future systems
elements.2211.03057_d3bad3043fad3909a43e3d1083d69: Apart from networking, a significant amount of energy is required for computation
elements.2211.03057_de42dec53c1961f21080a140d2d1f: For example, 3D modeling and simulation are essential for creating avatars, DTs, and virtual worlds
elements.2211.03057_304a3ee674b2990a8904b9893ae52: To create immersive and realistic experiences, 3D models are developed with computation-intensive simulations of physics, lighting, sound, and other elements
elements.2211.03057_a7f4a389ac6ff496e69ec0892959e: Compared to creating virtual worlds, around-the-clock server hosting and operations in data centers consume far more energy because of numerous user connections, heavy data traffic, and intensive computational load
elements.2211.03057_6637e9d4144b935ce8f9329cf7b90: Cloud-native solutions are required to offload compute-intensive tasks (e.g., 3D rendering and AI training) to high-end servers in remote data centers when the capability of the local computer is limited
elements.2211.03057_d22301e4cd4a29073ee8aa96bf97d: But the over-dependence on cloud computing could aggravate energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_93052ef916d7c58f4c4fdc3b3708c: Taking cloud gaming as an example, the power demand in the upstream network together with data center graphic processing was estimated to be markedly (e.g., 40-60
elements.2211.03057_b28f0e0f0817aa8914761cf7ae392: for laptops) higher than that of local gaming
elements.2211.03057_65d027f647194c2a8513909ad3d6e: Inevitably, the predominant cloud-based solutions of today lead to exacerbated energy challenges
elements.2211.03057_fc103148140ea4b3fa8869e153a61: Three major components contribute to the energy usage of data centers: physical servers, cooling systems, and network devices
elements.2211.03057_7067416026d7cd4f48a561b888907: To offset the strong growth in energy demand, remarkable efficiency improvements were implemented in servers, storage, network switches, and infrastructure design
elements.2211.03057_11ef579201097d1060d8e69a9e94d: The most efficient data centers nowadays reach a power usage effectiveness (PUE) of
elements.2211.03057_d49029e3d82002896aa065fddd5e9: 1.1, meaning that 0.1 kWh is used for cooling/power provision for every 1 kWh of IT usage.
elements.2211.03057_6fb4d586b894ca813c67aeab8bcae: AI plays an important role in endowing the Metaverse with autonomy and intelligence, thereby improving the QoE of users
elements.2211.03057_fafb32815f695239ff4c33c821323: For example, Computer Vision (CV), which derives meaningful information from images and videos, enables the Metaverse to provide services such as object detection, activity recognition, avatar navigation, and visual reasoning
elements.2211.03057_5a05dcd6e3868601e0ac90bd3d7c2: Natural Language Processing (NLP) enables conversational non-playable characters (NPCs) in the Metaverse and also provides services including language translation, text summarization, sentiment analysis, and speech recognition
elements.2211.03057_4995363313b5f8d752303b1cd496a: Generative AI utilizes existing text, audio files, or images to create 3D objects, digital assets (e.g., music, painting, article), user avatars, NPCs, and even whole virtual worlds.
elements.2211.03057_d415d53ca7fa42b62431f94843a47: Beyond creating innovative services, AI can be integrated with other technologies to provide more intelligent services, e.g., fast 3D rendering, efficient communication, and intelligent blockchains
elements.2211.03057_f0d4b6a4d19bb85cdb4ed61cc0011: Despite widespread applications, AI comes at a high cost economically and environmentally due to high energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_75bb8c30a5ef35f499c0e2107cf85: In AI training, computers are iteratively fed with training data and calculate the ML parameters continuously
elements.2211.03057_e00db09201ba46a41e49e68a322b5: Around 1000 MWh of electricity is spent to train a single language model like OpenAI GPT-3
elements.2211.03057_dc846903f8a391fcaaf3cb394ef8d: An exponential increase of compute used in the largest AI training was observed in the last decade with a 3.4-month doubling time.
elements.2211.03057_4eddfca3194db329c89ec9155956c: Fortunately, unlike cloud-centric AI training, AI inference is trending to be shifted to distributed edge devices for higher scalability, lower operational risks, and reduced latency
elements.2211.03057_e61035cf7a43edc3ff373fdabe912: However, this results in the additional challenges of limited processing power and energy supply of edge devices.
elements.2211.03057_ffa232c9f2e1be72a906c79d750af: To evaluate AI technologies, both accuracy and energy should be considered
elements.2211.03057_72ff4cf260c1d475164a7d4df2025: Accuracy metrics are well-defined and easily computed for specific tasks
elements.2211.03057_5a371861ee928e0f71027c866fd62: However, energy is rarely measurable and difficult to compute
elements.2211.03057_b5f71bbd4bf183b64efbebf74e372: Hence, a few alternatives have been used
elements.2211.03057_15bb8a21283d6dd5b8b147729ff6d: The model size measures the ML model's memory consumption, which is strongly dependent on the algorithm and model architecture
elements.2211.03057_5e8cc0ac0b7a7bb02fa7409075a50: The total number of floating-point operations (FLOPs) is used to approximate the number of multiply-and-accumulate (MAC) operations, indicate the computational workload, and imply energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_5bbd0b990ac70519f3c7cd845a835: Nonetheless, both metrics do not consider the impact of data movement between the memory unit and the processing unit, which may dominate the energy consumption in the computation
elements.2211.03057_1cf6e3f3818c224e57fe18783c49b: Thus, a few energy estimation methodologies were developed for precise energy estimation for specific ML models and hardware devices
elements.2211.03057_9a68dfbcb5811a8d3fa53d741e3fb: The trade-offs between accuracy and energy are necessary for AI training considering the diminishing marginal return of accuracy when increasing the dataset size and model complexity
elements.2211.03057_9fde5abf9772e1502c8e6f2a272b7: It is especially true for distributed AI training, e.g., federated learning (FL), when increasing the concurrency.

elements.2211.03057_c54f02e705c9c30f07c2354f17d15: XR extends physical reality into virtual reality to different extents: AR overlays virtual objects on the physical world and VR simulates a fully virtual world
elements.2211.03057_176d8c3c90a76882dd332cfea25f4: The emergence of XR revolutionizes the Metaverse by creating brand-new virtual experiences in any imaginable domain
elements.2211.03057_1a7a04b183c2dd6053904af33f27c: To have an immersive sensory experience, users wear a standalone HMD (e.g., Oculus Quest) or an HMD connected to a computer (e.g., Oculus Rift)
elements.2211.03057_94c3abac78bab1f748c8721ff4b39: High-end VR systems include sensors like accelerometers, gyroscopes, and magnetometers, which can collect more physical world data. 360
elements.2211.03057_46d65862c825058f0784aa79ce096: 2D videos rendered from 3D models are transmitted to the edge device or HMD for local processing before displaying behind the eyes.
elements.2211.03057_e437d4c98b2ede18aa37782b71446: VR video rendering is fulfilled mainly in data centers and edge computers due to the stringent requirements of processing hardware
elements.2211.03057_3c8b5e62551d2b5de83c27f20340b: It is reported to consume twice as much power as conventional planar video rendering in
elements.2211.03057_d473239bbc7f02c2ade61c46a2d1d: In HMDs, video processing expends the majority of the power budget
elements.2211.03057_1a5702357c3f3178d6a93f5b75bdf: Memory access and computation are two main contributors to video processing energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_3312f050692f02a3294764c22064d: Moreover, VR systems are increasingly used to execute additional functions, e.g., sensing data collection and processing, AI training and inference, and caching, further increasing the energy demand
elements.2211.03057_1dca349a1731d74bde4b2926f0c8b: VR QoS metrics mainly include latency, resolution, field of view (FOV), and frame per second (FPS)
elements.2211.03057_0429cba5d6324de2d50a1f7b7fd25: The power at QoS is typically used to compare energy efficiency
elements.2211.03057_bdc59fd6297989a7af8998e3f9d40: Nevertheless, a device with better QoS does not necessarily provide better visual quality
elements.2211.03057_608d6fb4305aec5eac7c225eec68a: For example, perceptually high-quality VR videos do not require uniformly high-quality pixels (i.e., full resolution) with a wide FOV
elements.2211.03057_91ccabec4f3337a67d4e4c4c33f67: QoE-based energy efficiency metrics encourage the development of VR systems with better visual quality and less power required
elements.2211.03057_fab1f7ab1f040c3027e6c34d0daaf: Detailed examples are illustrated in Section
elements.2211.03057_f0439e827fdaf2b1ce4ba461f7294: As a distributed database, the blockchain can be used to store the massive amount of data generated in the Metaverse, e.g., UGCs and IoT data
elements.2211.03057_ccbd437a4b2ff1cc90806d9afabcd: It decentralizes storage, improves scalability, reduces data transmission, and ensures data security and privacy
elements.2211.03057_a5bd6440e4635d663509dfc5f9ae3: The development of cross-chain protocols allows data exchange among blockchains and improves Metaverse interoperability
elements.2211.03057_8e73935140a44e812e7ffab7cc519: Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) are unique cryptographic tokens on blockchain indicating the ownership of digital or real-world items as well as transaction history
elements.2211.03057_be1df4724a4f3d0fffd95906a0901: NFTs can ensure uniqueness, track ownership, automate trading through smart contracts, and establish trust among parties, which highly motivates the creation of UGCs
elements.2211.03057_7ddfb5c2241e9fb0a5cbb6336bbcc: In contrast, cryptocurrency is adopted as a fungible digital currency with economic value
elements.2211.03057_3707118999dd795e1039e08d1f5ba: It eliminates the need for central authorities, reduces transaction costs, enhances security and privacy, and simplifies fund transfers
elements.2211.03057_0a6a0389e2acd22d4be59dbbd2cc0: Nevertheless, most of the existing blockchain applications are suffering deficiencies in operation efficiency and energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_ae8da7ffcf7b40f4772aafa60e38b: Annually, Bitcoin is estimated to consume 60-125 TWh of electrical energy, which is comparable to the yearly consumption of countries like Austria and Norway
elements.2211.03057_b4a1932060c7f6d712c01654336f4: A single transaction of Bitcoin requires enough electricity to supply an average size household in Germany for weeks, which is multiple orders of magnitude higher than traditional systems
elements.2211.03057_dff06d42ffce458a9fd625f6fce37: Two factors largely determine blockchain energy consumption.
elements.2211.03057_40dbc8d74ee1c8712bd30d879ab43: : Although there is a growing variety of consensus mechanisms, the majority of contemporary blockchain applications are based on Proof-of-Work (PoW) like Bitcoin
elements.2211.03057_8a303d24f68d75389cf94afa429a0: PoW involves network nodes solving computationally intensive puzzles and competing to create a new block, namely mining
elements.2211.03057_f94ddbb9d25120d974b8f946b376b: Because miners with more powerful hardware have a higher probability of success, it creates an arms race among miners and generates electronic waste.
elements.2211.03057_6f21d4110412846f65d4bb6c688d9: : After the consensus determines the valid transactions, these transactions are processed on each node of the blockchain network redundantly
elements.2211.03057_da98bf8852027ffe4ddb18bb1d9c5: The energy associated with this redundant operation is found orders of magnitude lower than that associated with consensus mechanism
elements.2211.03057_4ef95061a50ca18ea24357cc8b4bb: However, for non-PoW blockchains, where the consensus mechanism spends much less energy, this redundant operation may become a major energy consumer
elements.2211.03057_bc8d1f5012563b74b1354f64f9521: While redundancy gives more decentralization, reliability, and security, replicating full transaction data in every node imposes challenges to scalability and energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_2ee2b9b3c0f2cfbf9f23e0d0cfb48: In a holistic view, the idle power consumption of nodes should also be considered apart from the above factors
elements.2211.03057_8c2d9d6f00773678d5e2ab5db8a19: To evaluate overall energy efficiency, energy consumption per transaction is commonly used to compare blockchains to other technologies
elements.2211.03057_a056f85e4bf3b8ac7a353dc69220e: Based on this metric, most contemporary blockchain applications (e.g., Bitcoin) still spend a mammoth amount of energy compared to traditional payment systems (e.g., credit cards)
elements.2211.03057_a6ee7e17e148ed2b2683f61866497: Notably, this metric can be misleading because blockchain energy consumption largely depends on consensus mechanisms (e.g., mining in PoW) rather than transaction volume
elements.2211.03057_0a965b0e59319938d71de2c493fd9: In a nutshell, the overall energy consumption is still significant for current blockchains
elements.2211.03057_1c10e9e913573ddf59f5d9a0c0c54: The situation is expected to change after the worldâs second-largest cryptocurrency, Ethereum, shifts from PoW to a greener proof-of-stake (PoS) system in Q3/Q4 2022.
elements.2211.03057_a07a723245131a4c1db030303beaa: Employing energy-inefficient technologies is detrimental to the Metaverse scalability and results in profound negative impacts on the environment
elements.2211.03057_174bd7dd84bcf8eda41e616342ae8: are of great use to identify inefficient components in Metaverse networks
elements.2211.03057_fec12ae5693fef638d67f8044f5ab: In many cases, trade-offs must be well-balanced between higher energy consumption and improved user experience
elements.2211.03057_112175d768872fce5659ac150b1ef: As the Metaverse will be human-centric, QoE-based energy-efficiency measures must be designed to directly link user experience with energy usage.

elements.2211.03057_fd3e73cc94f8eae1c90050fd96081: An efficient model design contributes to reduced computation and considerable energy savings
elements.2211.03057_33494fd02a6188f7b82f278dbe3e6: Certain models inherently have lower power requirements, e.g., spiking neural networks (SNNs) leverage sparse event-driven spikes and MobileNet adopts depthwise convolution for reducing computation
elements.2211.03057_a64c0b164a85b53a8b9aa19e53c50: Compact architecture involves trade-offs on architecture hyperparameters
elements.2211.03057_c4085b9c08bbb3c93ddc72ca2e215: Increasing complexity results in diminishing marginal returns, and even sometimes hurts performance
elements.2211.03057_aaf379647a68d097ecd8ba4386ec9: Methods, e.g., Neural Architecture Search (NAS), have been developed to automate the design for optimal architectures
elements.2211.03057_de430c5dc49336bcddd28ce0a610a: Model compression provides an effective way to reduce model sizes and computation with minimal impact on performance
elements.2211.03057_aaccdc269b4ad7936b8b9044ed118: For example, pruning prunes out the non-critical sections (e.g., connections, neurons, and layers) in the neural networks
elements.2211.03057_f993b9275e7e870664e6180ddc61e: The energy-aware pruning reduces the AlexNet and GoogLeNet energy consumption by 3.7 and 1.6 times
elements.2211.03057_4150c12eca1eac8bb69692e1a5499: Quantization approximates floating-point numbers by low bit-width numbers for ML model parameters
elements.2211.03057_268d0ab19832870a8ec93b1451471: Model distillation, also called knowledge distillation, trains a small-size "student" model to mimic a large-size "teacher" model
elements.2211.03057_5c2cd4e65f0f3292897b5ea1fe260: The pruned, quantized, or distilled model is best suited for AI inference at scale
elements.2211.03057_20495d74e28b49a4108c8c079b70b: Moreover, dataset distillation distills a large dataset into a synthetic smaller dataset, which provides computation saving for repeated AI training experiments.
elements.2211.03057_13e5982c4e0bb242d74d739a95054: Computation can be performed in different manners, e.g., distributed computing and cloud computing
elements.2211.03057_ed7c79265707d7b7c9c35f6d2d063: When AI is trained in distributed edges, only extracted features of data or model artifacts require to be transmitted, which significantly reduces the data transmission in the network
elements.2211.03057_94cdc7c838d8198149a4edbd1a146: D2D communication can further increase the data transmission efficiency between edge computers and sensors
elements.2211.03057_4430acd40c9b6253460c0901f9ec3: FL is a typical distributed AI training technique based on edge computing
elements.2211.03057_8a74f51d55915f8c7434df4f0ee7c: Another advantage of edge computing is that it can leverage the diverse resources available in different locations
elements.2211.03057_e8e3524828fe5b580651a87d5b55d: For example, FL can enable workload allocation based on the available intermittent renewable energy to improve overall sustainability
elements.2211.03057_a4aef1c316e2a731bfe36529606a1: Cloud computing is advantageous when the efficiency of the individual device is much lower than the centralized high-end server
elements.2211.03057_085e9fc115c7e12b11068d36790d1: On the contrary, when data transmission is massive and costly, edge computing is more sustainable.
elements.2211.03057_858574fcfbc4f6e9465da6986032e: Software and algorithmic improvements play a key role in improving video processing efficiency

elements.2211.03057_c228c1babee626830ad179d0f2b6b: By memorizing head orientation and establishing a relation between left and right eye projection, some computations can be skipped
elements.2211.03057_6a2a3be0832e5055af4860d149c92: Another improvement opportunity lies in video encoding, which is performed before videos are transmitted to compress the video
elements.2211.03057_e7d5c41b8c8ad03513b1802f3e9da: It effectively reduces the amount of data for storage and transmission. 360
elements.2211.03057_de5c360981db92514bd68f8ee5026: VR videos are currently encoded in three ways: equirectangular projection, cubemap projection, and pyramid projection
elements.2211.03057_5df43229da3fc3e2c9bf2d631e69e: Compared to equirectangular projection, cubemap and pyramid projection can save 25
elements.2211.03057_4e0cedffde4acc6d5ead695890047: Characteristics and limitations of human visual perception provide opportunities to improve XR efficiency
elements.2211.03057_c6652f9b3f22f7b969e4064202af6: Firstly, the fovea, the central area of the human eye, has a substantially higher visual acuity than the rest of the retina
elements.2211.03057_5269d56156b937e6838adeed775f6: In light of this fact, foveated rendering is developed to render the gazed area of the image at a higher resolution and the peripheral area at a lower resolution
elements.2211.03057_5c87891041ff0dd6b3a8e6cf7d3f1: , it can achieve 3 times speedup and 70
elements.2211.03057_fe22b82cfef790f17e908a4579950: The same concept can also be incorporated with video compression to reduce the bandwidth and energy required during data transmission
elements.2211.03057_5599ffca323c46397901e763dfe3c: Secondly, the human visual system has limited capability to perceive details of high spatial and temporal frequencies
elements.2211.03057_b4cec6253d9592e467cab6668fb90: Rather than rendering all video frames at full resolution, if the resolution of every other fame is reduced, the perceived quality could be still maintained
elements.2211.03057_e6a64900caf880247640b2e4b3c42: Multiplex video resolution can also reduce both rendering workload and data transmission
elements.2211.03057_67716b4e0b0bb42da7077cb1a15b8: Furthermore, the dark adaptation is another feature of the human eye that increases visual sensitivity in a dark environment
elements.2211.03057_0a7254e94ae10604198ed7d346d65: By smoothly decreasing the brightness level of the screen, a significant amount of energy can be saved while keeping the same brightness perception.
elements.2211.03057_1478615cba5a4a87f1f36451fee97: The first type of green advancement lies in alternative energy-efficient consensus mechanisms, e.g., PoS, Delegated PoS (DPoS), and Proof-of-Authority (PoA)
elements.2211.03057_9010d34434d34b9d41a2a9055e1a1: PoS replaces miners with validators to validate transactions and add new blocks to the blockchain
elements.2211.03057_75f35d9d085922ba4022b578a8c3c: Instead of expending assets up-front as energy expenditure, validators stake crypto assets as collateral against dishonest behavior
elements.2211.03057_12b2653d39637709f176c68ff12b4: DPoS, a notable iteration of PoS, allows participants to elect delegates with voting power proportional to their stakes
elements.2211.03057_4366c1a698b8a5b7b54eb95ab2c7f: Only a capped number of delegates are chosen for transaction validation and block production
elements.2211.03057_9a2a73791c827ace6cfc6e04183ad: Thus, it makes consensus more efficient to reach, at the expense of decentrality
elements.2211.03057_401fa5f5a9da4c8b1ec235ed56732: While the above mechanisms are open to the public, PoA pre-approves participants with trustworthy identities
elements.2211.03057_8809be68c84446d84fc70725a2ab7: Participants stake identities and voluntarily disclose themselves to become validators
elements.2211.03057_a173020ba39c860b620baab4e4163: The simplicity of consensus-reaching processes and a smaller number of validators make PoA require minimal computational effort
elements.2211.03057_01162912e74784d3b4bac53383998: In short, eliminating the mining process significantly reduces blockchain energy consumption, at least 99.95
elements.2211.03057_60322645490ca5f8349d6fc8a6a71: The second type of advancement focuses on reducing operation redundancy, especially for non-PoW blockchains
elements.2211.03057_8624447becf04e6da7edc99cf547d: Reducing the number of nodes to process and the workload in the process can both contribute to redundancy reduction
elements.2211.03057_7d42d53f36549a3d2247964a0c362: The sharding technique splits the blockchain network into smaller independent partitions, i.e., shards, and processes each transaction only on nodes in one shard rather than the whole network
elements.2211.03057_893852324bf250691a335568716dc: Therefore the number of redundant operations can be reduced as well as the energy consumption
elements.2211.03057_e1de5e4adf8b25614e40c10858bf6: Layer 2 solutions aim to reduce the workload or complexity of the transaction operation by building a second-layer protocol on top of the foundational blockchain
elements.2211.03057_81eee136fd4c24e117946ed6e3e23: For example, the off-chain payment protocol (e.g., Lightning for Bitcoin and Raiden for Ethereum) creates a direct channel between two participants and enables instantaneous bidirectional transfers, as long as the net sum of transfers does not exceed the deposit
elements.2211.03057_4b47414b54f020e60e4893a3a83ce: Because the blockchain is involved only when the channel is created or closed, the intensive and redundant computation required for blockchain operations is largely avoided
elements.2211.03057_987857e36312eeaa93ca17ebcbd55: Zero-knowledge rollups (ZK-rollups) bundle transactions into batches and execute them off-chain
elements.2211.03057_8416f9d8b3722f940cd121b50354c: An easily verifiable proof is generated and submitted back to the blockchain, which proves the correctness of changes after executing a batch of transactions
elements.2211.03057_b5b245e5cca5a44d05216fea5c0f5: All blockchain participants validate the proof instead of raw transactions, obviously simplifying the workload
elements.2211.03057_f7578ead9589678456de0fbdbd147: Slightly offset by proof generation, ZK-rollup adoption is estimated to reduce 98.5
elements.2211.03057_56e4c3bf98e54d7a580748ed5abb1: Fields such as green communications and data centers are more advanced in sustainable development
elements.2211.03057_fbb64ae9e74b89b678dd5fe4edfea: Green AI and blockchain have taken off in recent years given more widespread adoption
elements.2211.03057_f3385bf5514031f3862ff2256fc1a: For XR, research on performance improvement, rather than green technologies, still dominates.
elements.2211.03057_eecd2ea6082612c7ab41a942bcb69: Case Study: Stochastic Resource Allocation for Semantic Communication in the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_61f550d2d7514a5cd3357355a59fb: This section presents a case study of the virtual transportation network (VTN) in the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_9f2fccc0c3ce9370faa10c6120623: For example, a transport company can create a VTN to provide on-the-job training for its drivers and to conduct large-scale user studies in a safe but realistic environment
elements.2211.03057_cacc6fba724a2a6542df194acb37d: A realistic VTN is developed through the synchronization of sensing data from edge devices in the physical world and DTs of the virtual world
elements.2211.03057_8c8e62ad098924337a3a3f97430d5: To keep DTs updated, sensing data is regularly transmitted to virtual service providers (VSPs)
elements.2211.03057_c3a397e18197b788de2f03a245d9e: It is energy-consuming to transmit data from edge devices to VSPs
elements.2211.03057_709d086f3c26c1ac5a8c8aae3c789: Specifically, the edge device transmits the original image to VSPs, while ignoring the semantic importance of the bit flow
elements.2211.03057_fc8ceff1e7e789c9379d5f1afd5c0: The objective of semantic communication is to be user-oriented, i.e., transmit only the part of semantic data interested by VSPs
elements.2211.03057_c8886206696bf73b63801f6f06fe4: For example, an autonomous driving company requires images (vehicles that are driving on the road) to train detection models in the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_de0563b988bbb6b21c18bdea001df: Therefore, instead of transmitting the entire captured images which involve other objects, the semantic extraction module outputs only the segmented objects of interest for transmission
elements.2211.03057_341ef763ffa9d7035debe1e832e93: With the help of semantic extraction using YOLO, we can validate in Fig.
elements.2211.03057_a4f788109a412abced6947951ba0e: that the energy consumption for semantic data transmission only requires 0.896J as compared to 111J for non-semantic data
elements.2211.03057_15e7a7ab48f0c77cd55c0956a986e: Moreover, inferences on pre-trained semantic extraction model such as YOLO requires very little energy
elements.2211.03057_ab3fd26a93b87fa3f894d718ba181: Therefore, with semantic communication, edge devices can reduce power consumption during transmission as well as storage costs.
elements.2211.03057_2e81b522f8732cef381fa141e65c9: To maintain DTs for realistic VTNs, VSPs may tap into data marketplaces that aggregate data from edge devices and sell to interested buyers
elements.2211.03057_af2b499ee386d7bf266df981e7901: We assume that the cost of data is proportional to the energy cost incurred by edge devices in the case study
elements.2211.03057_6a127fd53e91ba015880500e4b7bd: There are two types of subscription plans in data marketplaces, namely "reservation" and "on-demand"
elements.2211.03057_2efb5c5dfa4f50101d72c6e35170c: The reservation plan allows the VSPs to choose the edge device and purchase the number of data transmissions in advance
elements.2211.03057_497dfeeae98bc6a58d4d4a87c9e11: The on-demand plan is an ad-hoc plan that is only used when needed, so it is more expensive than the reservation plan
elements.2211.03057_bc1c556e44521509754ea21d75348: However, the demands of VSPs are constantly changing as it is highly dependent on the users' requests
elements.2211.03057_b8e30ba809ee3ffc07669a957244b: Furthermore, since the reservation plan is subscribed in advance, the demand of the VSPs may not be the same after the subscription
elements.2211.03057_18e86045bfab4ac1f16e2b9aed370: For example, the demand is initially the vehicles on the road
elements.2211.03057_8d25491491183d50fb6127c796809: After a while, the detection system may not be able to detect pedestrians very well under extreme weather conditions
elements.2211.03057_4bd4d90fb3d1d79ad2fcc4514f867: Hence, the on-demand plan may be triggered to obtain more data to update the AI model
elements.2211.03057_3da6a482ca51a4fbf5c593a4aaa72: However, if an incorrect plan is used, e.g., reserve the edge device that transmits semantic data irrelevant to the interest of VSP, energy is wasted from unwanted data transmission, and additional energy is required for re-transmission from other edge devices
elements.2211.03057_6dbf2bb402f18153782392e51a169: To account for the demand uncertainties of VSPs, we proposed a two-stage stochastic integer programming method to minimize the operation cost of VSPs as well as transmission energy
elements.2211.03057_784ee1c46630c1fc8d1a4bd235fe2: Using VSP historical demand data, our resource allocation scheme achieves a much lower cost than other schemes that do not consider the probability distribution of VSP demand (Fig.
elements.2211.03057_c366486134d5e34b659cfb21a5b97: Key Challenges and Future Research Directions
elements.2211.03057_13bbc0db1f5e66a2a2f0bf5feb37f: , we can observe that most of the sustainability-related metrics are based on conventional QoS factors
elements.2211.03057_694a8bb54ac2ad97875338bfd1ff9: In contrast, the recent paradigm shift towards the human-centered design of communication systems will shift the focus from QoS to QoE
elements.2211.03057_d3596ac8dd23fa8bdf060eacb242e: Unfortunately, QoE is highly subjective based on user preferences
elements.2211.03057_35ce7643e8b94e24bf03ae4b4fd8f: This is exacerbated by the fact that the Metaverse will feature a diverse range of applications and involve new modalities of user data
elements.2211.03057_60127a15683f115d54cfa68d47f84: As such, before we can design systems to optimize QoE-driven green metrics, it is important to redefine QoE through large-scale user studies.
elements.2211.03057_792c16bb0834d841e60a215bf383d: Such index is beneficial for Metaverse providers to plan an improvement roadmap, for users to choose green Metaverse products, and for governments to regulate the healthy development of the industry
elements.2211.03057_ecb8e20d21e148efcf006c7e9ce52: However, the enormous amount of technologies and stakeholders involved makes it challenging to assess the overall sustainability
elements.2211.03057_eed8bd9dfc5bdf1b2fafe3070c11a: Although technologies can be evaluated individually using the metrics in Table
elements.2211.03057_9a13820b706b1d7fab80b10261131: , their contributions to the Metaverse are still vague currently
elements.2211.03057_8ba43cf7b5ade3c8a466347fa0391: Practical frameworks and tools will be needed in the future to integrate diverse technological metrics and guide the overall assessment.
elements.2211.03057_090e084ec0d89106c45615d31c01d: While research typically focuses on maximization of system performance, e.g., attaining the highest accuracy/fastest inference of AI models or highest FPS in rendering, it is often the case that some applications may not require such extents of high performance
elements.2211.03057_88b1cba665b8685369a13d8660acf: In this case, the system performance can be slightly sacrificed to reduce the carbon footprint or energy per transaction
elements.2211.03057_f1732f7f088f41402c13cd0677cab: However, the trade-off between system performance and energy consumption has to be better studied.
elements.2211.03057_29da3fc713424033752f2727dd405: Incentive mechanisms designed to encourage green technology adoption, e.g., through tax credits or grants, have successfully encouraged the adoption of green office buildings
elements.2211.03057_fe6272d5fdae41ea0c48f1b809ea9: The next challenge will therefore be how can incentive mechanisms be designed to extend the coverage to the virtual worlds and the enabling technologies of the Metaverse.
elements.2211.03057_dbbb2b416cb19504ae84777cc0c2d: Diverse technologies are interconnected together in the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_fe00707afe816be18b110211f0020: On one hand, improving one technology might cause additional consumption to other technologies, e.g., compressed sensing and video encoding reduce the data transmission but increase the computation workload
elements.2211.03057_afda1307bb3b791fa7f9bf2d1196c: On the other hand, the full-system design could exploit a larger energy-saving potential than focusing on individual subsystems, e.g., synergistically approximating sensing, computing, memory, and communication
elements.2211.03057_fd0279461f5efda02130a27e29c13: Therefore, the system-level design is pivotal for orchestrating technological advancements towards the GMN.
elements.2211.03057_71359d9608e35d3fe1c4ca1935a8f: In this paper, we first present the energy-hungry technologies of the Metaverse
elements.2211.03057_b835aa01b16b6c6b56ce2c15b542b: Then, we discuss recent technological advances for the GMN
elements.2211.03057_b8b694422e183341ce1d142406b7b: We subsequently present a case study of the semantic communication-enabled Metaverse development
elements.2211.03057_dc532c6b8fd5a8fbfdb34f39dd106: Finally, we discuss the key challenges and future research directions.

elements.2211.03057_f0cb43efd312a6e3180840e694a78: While its definition is still fluid today, the Metaverse is generally regarded as an embodied version of the Internet that seamlessly synergizes virtual and physical worlds, and enables users to live and interact in virtual worlds through controlling personalized avatars
elements.2211.03057_e700a83b6ae9d7b97d9044e7fa0c6: Moreover, the COVID-19 pandemic has accustomed users to embracing digital life, e.g., online meetings and shopping
elements.2211.03057_ea6ad9daef182928a1438f9bfaa5d: As compared to the massively multiplayer online role-playing games (MMORPGs) of today, the Metaverse is a far broader concept that features user-generated content (UGC), a variety of use cases, decentralization, and interoperability across platforms and devices
elements.2211.03057_b7abe92208f49bbef35490ff7492b: The energy demand could easily escalate as the Metaverse will require 1000-fold more computing power and push data usage by 20 times in the next 10 years.
elements.2211.03057_f91014d2ed1b16ab9e2d811474f75: Therefore, this article makes the first effort to optimize energy efficiencies of all network components for realizing the Metaverse, i.e., Green Metaverse Networking (GMN)
elements.2211.03057_a88bf8da1c33a0be61d512c077776: The structure and key novelties of this article are as follows:
elements.2211.03057_20369ac871f729870e0ae0cf023b9: We identify energy-hungry technologies and their application scenarios, analyze their consumption, efficiency, and influencing factors, and outline sustainability-related metrics, thereby providing an analytical framework for assessing the Metaverse sustainability in Section
elements.2211.03057_a236b6524aa57df207c8d70fe4e3f: We review the forefront computing and networking advancements of these technologies towards GMN in Section
elements.2211.03057_1fbf92cff559bc779919cc4d0f080: We outline the critical challenges and future research directions towards GMN in Section

elements.2211.03057_1b0f0a794c47025bc9b8ebcff0f21: Undoubtedly, the increasing quantity and complexity of IoT devices would impose challenges on sustainable energy supply, especially since most devices are wireless and powered by limited batteries
